_class_ asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/session.html#SSHTunTapSession) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession "Link to this definition")

SSH TUN/TAP session handler

Applications should subclass this when implementing a handler for
SSH TUN/TAP tunnels.

SSH client applications wishing to open a tunnel should call
[`create_tun()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.create_tun "asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.create_tun") or
[`create_tap()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.create_tap "asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.create_tap") on their
[`SSHClientConnection`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientConnection "asyncssh.SSHClientConnection"), passing in a factory which returns
instances of this class.

Server applications wishing to allow tunnel connections should
implement the coroutine [`tun_requested()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServer.tun_requested "asyncssh.SSHServer.tun_requested") or [`tap_requested()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServer.tap_requested "asyncssh.SSHServer.tap_requested") on their [`SSHServer`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServer "asyncssh.SSHServer") object
and have it return instances of this class.

When a connection is successfully opened, [`session_started()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession.session_started")
will be called, after which the application can begin sending data.
Received data will be passed to the [`data_received()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession.data_received "asyncssh.SSHTunTapSession.data_received") method.

| get_extra_info( _name_, _default=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_extra_info "Link to this definition")<br>Get additional information about the channel<br>This method returns extra information about the channel once<br>it is established. Supported values include `'connection'`<br>to return the SSH connection this channel is running over plus<br>all of the values supported on that connection.<br>For TCP channels, the values `'local_peername'` and<br>`'remote_peername'` are added to return the local and remote<br>host and port information for the tunneled TCP connection.<br>For UNIX channels, the values `'local_peername'` and<br>`'remote_peername'` are added to return the local and remote<br>path information for the tunneled UNIX domain socket connection.<br>Since UNIX domain sockets provide no “source” address, only<br>one of these will be filled in.<br>See [`get_extra_info()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.get_extra_info "asyncssh.SSHClientConnection.get_extra_info")<br>on [`SSHClientConnection`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientConnection "asyncssh.SSHClientConnection") for more information.<br>Additional information stored on the channel by calling<br>[`set_extra_info()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.set_extra_info "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.set_extra_info") can also be returned here. |     |
| set_extra_info( _\*\*kwargs_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.set_extra_info "Link to this definition")<br>Store additional information associated with the channel<br>This method allows extra information to be associated with the<br>channel. The information to store should be passed in as<br>keyword parameters and can later be returned by calling<br>[`get_extra_info()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_extra_info "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_extra_info") with one of the keywords as the name<br>to retrieve.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |     |
| get_environment() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_environment "Link to this definition")<br>Return the environment for this session<br>This method returns the environment set by the client when<br>the session was opened. Keys and values are of type [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")<br>and this object only provides access to keys and values sent<br>as valid UTF-8 strings. Use `get_environment_bytes()`<br>if you need to access environment variables with keys or<br>values containing binary data or non-UTF-8 encodings.<br>On the server, calls to this method should only be made after<br>[`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has<br>been called on the [`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the<br>stream-based API, calls to this can be made at any time after<br>the handler function has started up.<br>Returns:<br>A dictionary containing the environment variables<br>set by the client                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |     |
| get_command() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_command "Link to this definition")<br>Return the command the client requested to execute, if any<br>This method returns the command the client requested to<br>execute when the session was opened, if any. If the client<br>did not request that a command be executed, this method<br>will return [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)"). On the server, calls to this method<br>should only be made after [`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has been called on the<br>[`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the stream-based API,<br>calls to this can be made at any time after the handler<br>function has started up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |     |
| get_subsystem() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_subsystem "Link to this definition")<br>Return the subsystem the client requested to open, if any<br>This method returns the subsystem the client requested to<br>open when the session was opened, if any. If the client<br>did not request that a subsystem be opened, this method will<br>return [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)"). On the server, calls to this method should<br>only be made after [`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has been called on the<br>[`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the stream-based API,<br>calls to this can be made at any time after the handler<br>function has started up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |     |

| Client channel read methods                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |     |

| pause_reading() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.pause_reading "Link to this definition")<br>Pause delivery of incoming data<br>This method is used to temporarily suspend delivery of incoming<br>channel data. After this call, incoming data will no longer<br>be delivered until [`resume_reading()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.resume_reading "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.resume_reading") is called. Data will be<br>buffered locally up to the configured SSH channel window size,<br>but window updates will no longer be sent, eventually causing<br>back pressure on the remote system.<br>Note<br>Channel close notifications are not suspended by this<br>call. If the remote system closes the channel while<br>delivery is suspended, the channel will be closed even<br>though some buffered data may not have been delivered. |     |
| resume_reading() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.resume_reading "Link to this definition")<br>Resume delivery of incoming data<br>This method can be called to resume delivery of incoming data<br>which was suspended by a call to [`pause_reading()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.pause_reading "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.pause_reading"). As soon<br>as this method is called, any buffered data will be delivered<br>immediately. A pending end-of-file notification may also be<br>delivered if one was queued while reading was paused.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |     |

| get_write_buffer_size() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_write_buffer_size "Link to this definition")<br>Return the current size of the channel’s output buffer<br>This method returns how many bytes are currently in the<br>channel’s output buffer waiting to be written.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |     |
| set_write_buffer_limits( _high=None_, _low=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.set_write_buffer_limits "Link to this definition")<br>Set the high- and low-water limits for write flow control<br>This method sets the limits used when deciding when to call<br>the [`pause_writing()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientSession.pause_writing "asyncssh.SSHClientSession.pause_writing")<br>and [`resume_writing()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientSession.resume_writing "asyncssh.SSHClientSession.resume_writing")<br>methods on SSH sessions. Writing will be paused when the write<br>buffer size exceeds the high-water mark, and resumed when the<br>write buffer size equals or drops below the low-water mark.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |     |
| write( _data_, _datatype=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.write "Link to this definition")<br>Write data on the channel<br>This method can be called to send data on the channel. If<br>an encoding was specified when the channel was created, the<br>data should be provided as a string and will be converted<br>using that encoding. Otherwise, the data should be provided<br>as bytes.<br>An extended data type can optionally be provided. For<br>instance, this is used from a [`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession")<br>to write data to `stderr`.<br>Parameters:<br>- **data** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)") or [`bytes`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes "(in Python v3.13)")) – The data to send on the channel<br> <br>- **datatype** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The extended data type of the data, from [extended\<br> data types](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#extendeddatatypes)<br> <br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open for sending<br>or the extended data type is not valid for this type<br>of channel |     |
| writelines( _list_of_data_, _datatype=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.writelines "Link to this definition")<br>Write a list of data bytes on the channel<br>This method can be called to write a list (or any iterable) of<br>data bytes to the channel. It is functionality equivalent to<br>calling [`write()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.write "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.write") on each element in the list.<br>Parameters:<br>- **list_of_data** (iterable of [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)") or [`bytes`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes "(in Python v3.13)")) – The data to send on the channel<br> <br>- **datatype** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The extended data type of the data, from [extended\<br> data types](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#extendeddatatypes)<br> <br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open for sending<br>or the extended data type is not valid for this type<br>of channel                                                                                                                                                            |     |
| write_eof() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.write_eof "Link to this definition")<br>Write EOF on the channel<br>This method sends an end-of-file indication on the<br>channel, after which no more data can be sent. The<br>channel remains open, though, and data may still be<br>sent in the other direction.<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open for sending                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                        |     |

If neither has been sent, this method<br>returns [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |     |
| get_exit_signal() [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.get_exit_signal) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.get_exit_signal "Link to this definition")<br>Return the session’s exit signal, if one was sent<br>This method returns information about the exit signal sent on<br>this session. Otherwise, this method returns [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)").                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |     |

| change_terminal_size( _width_, _height_, _pixwidth=0_, _pixheight=0_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.change_terminal_size) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.change_terminal_size "Link to this definition")<br>Change the terminal window size for this session<br>This method changes the width and height of the terminal<br>associated with this session.<br>Parameters:<br>- **width** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – The width of the terminal in characters<br> <br>- **height** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – The height of the terminal in characters<br> <br>- **pixwidth** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The width of the terminal in pixels<br> <br>- **pixheight** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The height of the terminal in pixels                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                             |     |
| send_break( _msec_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.send_break) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_break "Link to this definition")<br>Send a break to the remote process<br>This method requests that the server perform a break<br>operation on the remote process or service as described in<br>[**RFC 4335**](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4335.html).<br>Parameters:<br>**msec** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – The duration of the break in milliseconds<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel is not open                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |     |
| send_signal( _signal_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.send_signal) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal "Link to this definition")<br>Send a signal to the remote process<br>This method can be called to deliver a signal to the remote<br>process or service. Signal names should be as described in<br>section 6.10 of [**RFC 4254**](https://datatracker.ietf.org/doc/html/rfc4254.html#section-6.10), or<br>can be integer values as defined in the [`signal`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/signal.html#module-signal "(in Python v3.13)")<br>module, in which case they will be translated to their<br>corresponding signal name before being sent.<br>Note<br>OpenSSH’s SSH server implementation prior to version<br>7.9 does not support this message, so attempts to<br>use [`send_signal()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal"), [`terminate()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.terminate "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.terminate"), or<br>[`kill()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.kill "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.kill") with an older OpenSSH SSH server will<br>end up being ignored. This was tracked in OpenSSH<br>[bug 1424](https://bugzilla.mindrot.org/show_bug.cgi?id=1424).<br>Parameters:<br>**signal** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)") or [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – The signal to deliver<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel is not open<br>[`ValueError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#ValueError "(in Python v3.13)") if the signal number is unknown |     |
| kill() [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.kill) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.kill "Link to this definition")<br>Forcibly kill the remote process<br>This method can be called to forcibly stop the remote process<br>or service by sending it a `KILL` signal.<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel is not open<br>Note<br>If your server-side runs on OpenSSH,<br>this might be ineffective;<br>for more details, see the note in<br>[`send_signal()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |     |
| terminate() [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHClientChannel.terminate) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.terminate "Link to this definition")<br>Terminate the remote process<br>This method can be called to terminate the remote process or<br>service by sending it a `TERM` signal.<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel is not open<br>Note<br>If your server-side runs on OpenSSH,<br>this might be ineffective;<br>for more details, see the note in<br>[`send_signal()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal "asyncssh.SSHClientChannel.send_signal")                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                            |     |

The information to store should be passed in as<br>keyword parameters and can later be returned by calling<br>[`get_extra_info()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.get_extra_info "asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.get_extra_info") with one of the keywords as the name<br>to retrieve.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                           |     |
| get_environment() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.get_environment "Link to this definition")<br>Return the environment for this session<br>This method returns the environment set by the client when<br>the session was opened. Keys and values are of type [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")<br>and this object only provides access to keys and values sent<br>as valid UTF-8 strings. Use `get_environment_bytes()`<br>if you need to access environment variables with keys or<br>values containing binary data or non-UTF-8 encodings.<br>On the server, calls to this method should only be made after<br>[`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has<br>been called on the [`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the<br>stream-based API, calls to this can be made at any time after<br>the handler function has started up.<br>Returns:<br>A dictionary containing the environment variables<br>set by the client                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                       |     |

If the client<br>did not request that a command be executed, this method<br>will return [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)"). On the server, calls to this method<br>should only be made after [`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has been called on the<br>[`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the stream-based API,<br>calls to this can be made at any time after the handler<br>function has started up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |     |
| get_subsystem() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.get_subsystem "Link to this definition")<br>Return the subsystem the client requested to open, if any<br>This method returns the subsystem the client requested to<br>open when the session was opened, if any. If the client<br>did not request that a subsystem be opened, this method will<br>return [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)"). On the server, calls to this method should<br>only be made after [`session_started`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started "asyncssh.SSHServerSession.session_started") has been called on the<br>[`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession"). When using the stream-based API,<br>calls to this can be made at any time after the handler<br>function has started up.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |     |

When using the stream-based API,<br>calls to this can be made at any time after the handler<br>function has started up.<br>Parameters:<br>**mode** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – POSIX terminal mode taken from [POSIX terminal modes](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#ptymodes) to look up<br>Returns:<br>An [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)") containing the value of the requested<br>POSIX terminal mode or [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)") if the requested<br>mode was not set |     |

| Server channel read methods                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |     |

| pause_reading() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.pause_reading "Link to this definition")<br>Pause delivery of incoming data<br>This method is used to temporarily suspend delivery of incoming<br>channel data. After this call, incoming data will no longer<br>be delivered until [`resume_reading()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.resume_reading "asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.resume_reading") is called. Data will be<br>buffered locally up to the configured SSH channel window size,<br>but window updates will no longer be sent, eventually causing<br>back pressure on the remote system.<br>Note<br>Channel close notifications are not suspended by this<br>call. If the remote system closes the channel while<br>delivery is suspended, the channel will be closed even<br>though some buffered data may not have been delivered. |     |
| resume_reading() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.resume_reading "Link to this definition")<br>Resume delivery of incoming data<br>This method can be called to resume delivery of incoming data<br>which was suspended by a call to [`pause_reading()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.pause_reading "asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.pause_reading"). As soon<br>as this method is called, any buffered data will be delivered<br>immediately. A pending end-of-file notification may also be<br>delivered if one was queued while reading was paused.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                |     |

| set_write_buffer_limits( _high=None_, _low=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.set_write_buffer_limits "Link to this definition")<br>Set the high- and low-water limits for write flow control<br>This method sets the limits used when deciding when to call<br>the [`pause_writing()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientSession.pause_writing "asyncssh.SSHClientSession.pause_writing")<br>and [`resume_writing()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHClientSession.resume_writing "asyncssh.SSHClientSession.resume_writing")<br>methods on SSH sessions. Writing will be paused when the write<br>buffer size exceeds the high-water mark, and resumed when the<br>write buffer size equals or drops below the low-water mark.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                               |     |
| write( _data_, _datatype=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.write "Link to this definition")<br>Write data on the channel<br>This method can be called to send data on the channel. If<br>an encoding was specified when the channel was created, the<br>data should be provided as a string and will be converted<br>using that encoding. Otherwise, the data should be provided<br>as bytes.<br>An extended data type can optionally be provided. For<br>instance, this is used from a [`SSHServerSession`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerSession "asyncssh.SSHServerSession")<br>to write data to `stderr`.<br>Parameters:<br>- **data** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)") or [`bytes`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes "(in Python v3.13)")) – The data to send on the channel<br> <br>- **datatype** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The extended data type of the data, from [extended\<br> data types](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#extendeddatatypes)<br> <br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open for sending<br>or the extended data type is not valid for this type<br>of channel |     |
| writelines( _list_of_data_, _datatype=None_) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.writelines "Link to this definition")<br>Write a list of data bytes on the channel<br>This method can be called to write a list (or any iterable) of<br>data bytes to the channel. | write_stderr( _data_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHServerChannel.write_stderr) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.write_stderr "Link to this definition")<br>Write output to stderr<br>This method can be called to send output to the client which<br>is intended to be displayed on stderr. Otherwise, the data should be provided as bytes.<br>Parameters:<br>**data** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)") or [`bytes`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#bytes "(in Python v3.13)")) – The data to send to stderr<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open for sending                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |     |
| writelines_stderr( _list_of_data_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHServerChannel.writelines_stderr) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.writelines_stderr "Link to this definition")<br>Write a list of data bytes to stderr<br>This method can be called to write a list (or any iterable) of<br>data bytes to the channel. It is functionality equivalent to<br>calling [`write_stderr()`](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.write_stderr "asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.write_stderr") on each element in the list.                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    |     |
| write_eof() [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.write_eof "Link to this definition")<br>Write EOF on the channel<br>This method sends an end-of-file indication on the<br>channel, after which no more data can be sent. | set_xon_xoff( _client_can_do_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHServerChannel.set_xon_xoff) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.set_xon_xoff "Link to this definition")<br>Set whether the client should enable XON/XOFF flow control<br>This method can be called to tell the client whether or not<br>to enable XON/XOFF flow control, indicating that it should<br>intercept Control-S and Control-Q coming from its local<br>terminal to pause and resume output, respectively.<br>Applications should set client_can_do to [`True`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#True "(in Python v3.13)") to<br>enable this functionality or to [`False`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#False "(in Python v3.13)") to tell the client<br>to forward Control-S and Control-Q through as normal input.<br>Parameters:<br>**client_can_do** ( [`bool`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.13)")) – Whether or not the client should enable XON/XOFF flow control                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |     |
| exit( _status_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHServerChannel.exit) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.exit "Link to this definition")<br>Send exit status and close the channel<br>This method can be called to report an exit status for the<br>process back to the client and close the channel. A zero<br>exit status is generally returned when the operation was<br>successful. After reporting the status, the channel is<br>closed.<br>Parameters:<br>**status** ( [`int`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#int "(in Python v3.13)")) – The exit status to report to the client<br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                   |     |
| exit_with_signal( _signal_, _core_dumped=False_, _msg=''_, _lang='en-US'_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/channel.html#SSHServerChannel.exit_with_signal) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHServerChannel.exit_with_signal "Link to this definition")<br>Send exit signal and close the channel<br>This method can be called to report that the process<br>terminated abnormslly with a signal. A more detailed<br>error message may also provided, along with an indication<br>of whether or not the process dumped core. After<br>reporting the signal, the channel is closed.<br>Parameters:<br>- **signal** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")) – The signal which caused the process to exit<br> <br>- **core_dumped** ( [`bool`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> Whether or not the process dumped core<br> <br>- **msg** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> Details about what error occurred<br> <br>- **lang** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")) – (optional)<br> The language the error message is in<br> <br>Raises:<br>[`OSError`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/exceptions.html#OSError "(in Python v3.13)") if the channel isn’t open |     |

_class_ asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/editor.html#SSHLineEditorChannel) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel "Link to this definition")

Input line editor channel wrapper

When creating server channels with `line_editor` set to [`True`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#True "(in Python v3.13)"),
this class is wrapped around the channel, providing the caller with
the ability to enable and disable input line editing and echoing.

Note

Line editing is only available when a pseudo-terminal
is requested on the server channel and the character
encoding on the channel is not set to [`None`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#None "(in Python v3.13)").

| Line editor methods                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                     |     |
| --------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------- | --- |
| register_key( _key_, _handler_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/editor.html#SSHLineEditorChannel.register_key) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel.register_key "Link to this definition")<br>Register a handler to be called when a key is pressed<br>This method registers a handler function which will be called<br>when a user presses the specified key while inputting a line.<br>The handler will be called with arguments of the current<br>input line and cursor position, and updated versions of these<br>two values should be returned as a tuple.<br>The handler can also return a tuple of a signal name and<br>negative cursor position to cause a signal to be delivered<br>on the channel. In this case, the current input line is left<br>unchanged but the signal is delivered before processing any<br>additional input. This can be used to define “hot keys” that<br>trigger actions unrelated to editing the input.<br>If the registered key is printable text, returning [`True`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#True "(in Python v3.13)") will<br>insert that text at the current cursor position, acting as if<br>no handler was registered for that key. This is useful if you<br>want to perform a special action in some cases but not others,<br>such as based on the current cursor position.<br>Returning [`False`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/constants.html#False "(in Python v3.13)") will ring the bell and leave the input<br>unchanged, indicating the requested action could not be<br>performed.<br>Parameters:<br>- **key** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")) – The key sequence to look for<br> <br>- **handler** ( [`callable`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#callable "(in Python v3.13)")) – The handler function to call when the key is pressed |     |
| unregister_key( _key_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/editor.html#SSHLineEditorChannel.unregister_key) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel.unregister_key "Link to this definition")<br>Remove the handler associated with a key<br>This method removes a handler function associated with<br>the specified key. If the key sequence is printable,<br>this will cause it to return to being inserted at the<br>current position when pressed. Otherwise, it will cause<br>the bell to ring to signal the key is not understood.<br>Parameters:<br>**key** ( [`str`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/stdtypes.html#str "(in Python v3.13)")) – The key sequence to look for                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                 |     |
| set_line_mode( _line_mode_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/editor.html#SSHLineEditorChannel.set_line_mode) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel.set_line_mode "Link to this definition")<br>Enable/disable input line editing<br>This method enabled or disables input line editing. When set,<br>only full lines of input are sent to the session, and each<br>line of input can be edited before it is sent.<br>Parameters:<br>**line_mode** ( [`bool`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.13)")) – Whether or not to process input a line at a time                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      |     |
| set_echo( _echo_) [\[source\]](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/_modules/asyncssh/editor.html#SSHLineEditorChannel.set_echo) [¶](https://asyncssh.readthedocs.io/en/latest/api.html#asyncssh.SSHLineEditorChannel.set_echo "Link to this definition")<br>Enable/disable echoing of input in line mode<br>This method enables or disables echoing of input data when<br>input line editing is enabled.<br>Parameters:<br>**echo** ( [`bool`](https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#bool "(in Python v3.13)")) – Whether or not input to echo input as it is entered                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  |     |
